authors.author: Henry S. Coffin John M. Neale Thomas Helmore

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines: Shall come to thee, O Israel!

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
O come, O come Emmanuel
And ransom captive Israel,

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
That mourns in lonely exile here
Until the Son of God appear.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
O come, thou Wisdom from on high,
And order all things far and nigh;

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
To us the path of knowledge show
And cause us in her ways to go.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
O come, O come, great Lord of might,
Who to Thy tribes on Sinai's height

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
In ancient times once gave the law
In cloud and majesty and awe.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
O come, thou Root of Jesse's tree,
An ensign of Thy people be;

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
Before Thee rulers silent fall;
All peoples on Thy mercy call.

verse.name: v5a
verse.lines:
O come, thou Key of David, come,
And open wide our heavenly home.

verse.name: v5b
verse.lines:
The captives from their prison free,
And conquer death's deep misery.

verse.name: v6a
verse.lines:
O come, thou Dayspring, come and cheer
Our spirits by Thy justice here;

verse.name: v6b
verse.lines:
Disperse the gloomy clouds of night,
And death's dark shadows put to flight.

verse.name: v7a
verse.lines:
O come, Desire of nations bind
All peoples in one heart and mind.

verse.name: v7b
verse.lines:
From dust Thou brought us forth to life;
Deliver us from earthly strife.
